info.description: Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (FHIR, pronounced "Fire") defines a set of "Resources" that represent granular clinical concepts. The resources can be managed in isolation, or aggregated into complex documents. Technically, FHIR is designed for the web; the resources are based on simple XML or JSON structures, with an http-based RESTful protocol where each resource has predictable URL. Where possible, open internet standards are used for data representation.
info.title: FHIR Observation resource API documentation

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Specify access token for API in the given format: Bearer [access_token].

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The Accept request-header field can be used to specify certain media types which are acceptable for the response.

parameters.name: Resource data
parameters.description: The request body should be a valid data payload.

parameters.name: If-None-Exist
parameters.description: Specify the search query for conditional create.

400.description: Observation could not be parsed or failed basic FHIR validation rules

422.description: The Observation resource violated applicable FHIR profiles or server business rules.

post.description:
Create a new Observation with a server assigned id.

FHIR documentation for Observation.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Specify access token for API in the given format: Bearer [access_token].

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The Accept request-header field can be used to specify certain media types which are acceptable for the response.

parameters.name: Resource data
parameters.description: The request body should be a valid data payload.

parameters.name: _content
parameters.description: Search the contents of the resource's data using a fulltext search

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: The resource identity

parameters.name: _language
parameters.description: The resource language

parameters.name: _lastUpdated
parameters.description: Only return resources which were last updated as specified by the given range. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: _profile
parameters.description: Search for resources which have the given profile

parameters.name: _security
parameters.description: Search for resources which have the given security labels

parameters.name: _tag
parameters.description: Search for resources which have the given tag

parameters.name: _text
parameters.description: Search the contents of the resource's narrative using a fulltext search

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: The classification of the type of observation

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: The code of the observation type

parameters.name: code-value-concept
parameters.description: Both code and one of the value parameters

parameters.name: code-value-date
parameters.description: Both code and one of the value parameters

parameters.name: code-value-quantity
parameters.description: Both code and one of the value parameters

parameters.name: code-value-string
parameters.description: Both code and one of the value parameters

parameters.name: component-code
parameters.description: The component code of the observation type

parameters.name: component-code-component-value-concept
parameters.description: Both component code and one of the component value parameters

parameters.name: component-code-component-value-quantity
parameters.description: Both component code and one of the component value parameters

parameters.name: component-code-component-value-string
parameters.description: Both component code and one of the component value parameters

parameters.name: component-data-absent-reason
parameters.description: The reason why the expected value in the element Observation.component.value[x] is missing.

parameters.name: component-value-concept
parameters.description: The value of the component observation, if the value is a CodeableConcept

parameters.name: component-value-quantity
parameters.description: The value of the component observation, if the value is a Quantity, or a SampledData (just search on the bounds of the values in sampled data)

parameters.name: component-value-string
parameters.description: The value of the component observation, if the value is a string, and also searches in CodeableConcept.text

parameters.name: data-absent-reason
parameters.description: The reason why the expected value in the element Observation.value[x] is missing.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Obtained date/time. If the obtained element is a period, a date that falls in the period. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: device
parameters.description: The Device that generated the observation data.

parameters.name: encounter
parameters.description: Healthcare event related to the observation

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: The unique id for a particular observation

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: The subject that the observation is about (if patient)

parameters.name: performer
parameters.description: Who performed the observation

parameters.name: related-target
parameters.description: Resource that is related to this one

parameters.name: related-target-related-type
parameters.description: Related Observations - search on related-type and related-target together

parameters.name: related-type
parameters.description: has-member | derived-from | sequel-to | replaces | qualified-by | interfered-by

parameters.name: specimen
parameters.description: Specimen used for this observation

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The status of the observation

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: The subject that the observation is about

parameters.name: value-concept
parameters.description: The value of the observation, if the value is a CodeableConcept

parameters.name: value-date
parameters.description: The value of the observation, if the value is a date or period of time. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: value-quantity
parameters.description: The value of the observation, if the value is a Quantity, or a SampledData (just search on the bounds of the values in sampled data)

parameters.name: value-string
parameters.description: The value of the observation, if the value is a string, and also searches in CodeableConcept.text

400.description: Observation could not be parsed or failed basic FHIR validation rules (or multiple matches were found).

412.description: The given criteria is not selective enough.

put.description:
The conditional update interaction is used to update an existing Observation based on some identification criteria, rather than by logical id.

delete.description:
The conditional delete interaction allows a client to delete Observation/Observations based on some selection criteria, rather than by a specific logical id.

get.description:
Returns Observations based on filter criteria OR Provides provision for pagination (stateid, page, page_size, _pretty & _bundletype are query parameters used for Paging).

parameters.name: _count
parameters.description: Number of records needed in response.

parameters.name: _since
parameters.description: Specify an instant to only include resource versions that were created at or after the given instant in time. An instant in time is known at least to the second and always includes a time zone.

parameters.description: The logical resource id associated with the Resource.

get.description:

parameters.description: Related Observations - search on related-type and related-target together

parameters.name: related-type
parameters.description: has-member | derived-from | sequel-to | replaces | qualified-by | interfered-by

parameters.name: specimen
parameters.description: Specimen used for this observation

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The status of the observation

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: The subject that the observation is about

parameters.name: value-concept
parameters.description: The value of the observation, if the value is a CodeableConcept

parameters.name: value-date
parameters.description: The value of the observation, if the value is a date or period of time. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: value-quantity
parameters.description: The value of the observation, if the value is a Quantity, or a SampledData (just search on the bounds of the values in sampled data)

parameters.name: value-string
parameters.description: The value of the observation, if the value is a string, and also searches in CodeableConcept.text

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Specify access token for API in the given format: Bearer [access_token].

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The Accept request-header field can be used to specify certain media types which are acceptable for the response.

post.description:
This interaction searches a set of Observations based on some filter criteria. Search interactions take a series of parameters of name'='value pairs encoded as an application/x-www-form-urlencoded submission for a POST.

FHIR documentation for Observation.

parameters.name: Resource data
parameters.description: The request body should be a valid meta payload.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Specify access token for API in the given format: Bearer [access_token].

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The Accept request-header field can be used to specify certain media types which are acceptable for the response.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The logical resource id associated with the Resource.

400.description: Observation could not be parsed or failed basic FHIR validation rules

422.description: The Observation resource violated applicable FHIR profiles or server business rules.

post.description:
Add a metadata info Observation with specified id.
